records.Title: Addressing human -wildlife conflicts and risks of trade in endangered species through restoration of ecosystems and implementation of Nature-based solutions.
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change Ministry of Agriculture FAO-Uzbekistan ICARDA-CAC IUCN
records.Description of the side event: Presentation of Ramsar National Strategy of Uzbekistan The importance of Ramsar sites for biodiversity and migratory species

records.Title: High Level Segment
records.Description of the side event: High Level Segment

records.Title: EPI Members meeting
records.Organizer/Chair: Co-hosted by the Governments of Angola, Ethiopia, Malawi and Nigeria with the EPI Foundation
records.Description of the side event: Honorable Sharon Ikeazor invites the representatives of the 26 member states of the Elephant Protection Initiative (EPI) to a closed-door meeting to coordinate policy and strategy on elephant conservation.

records.Title: Inter-WENs cooperation
records.Organizer/Chair: South Asia Wildlife Enforcement Network (SAWEN) with LATF and DNPWC, Nepal
records.Description of the side event: The event will promote alignment between regional enforcement mechanisms and the CITES framework by exploring opportunities for enhanced inter-WEN collaboration, mutual capacity building, and sustained donor engagement.

records.Title: Data Sharing and IWT
records.Organizer/Chair:
Fauna & Flora International 
Co-hosted ACBK, Institute of Zoology of UZ, TRAFFIC etc.
records.Description of the side event:
This side event will focus on the importance of data sharing among key ministries and agencies to address illegal wildlife trade (IWT). There are ongoing gaps and challenges to effective law enforcement responses to effectively tackle IWT. A critical one is the paucity of data collection, and limited sharing of existing data between agencies and ministries mandated to address IWT. 

This event will bring together representatives from across the world, including Central Asia, to showcase efforts to develop data sharing mechanisms.  It will look at the wider successes, challenges, and importance of data sharing for effective informed responses to IWT and will draw upon global examples of best practice, to inform and strengthen regional awareness and coordinated responses to IWT, especially in the Central Asian context.

records.Title: KHA - Key Herpetological Areas. A new international conservation initiative
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change of the Republic of Uzbekistan Institute of Zoology of the Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Uzbekistan
records.Description of the side event: KHA - Key Herpetological Areas. A new international conservation initiative

records.Title: Integrating Habitat Quality into CITES Sustainability Measures
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries Republic of Indonesia
records.Description of the side event: This side event will explore the critical link between international trade, species sustainability, and habitat integrity, aligning with the broader goals of the Kunming–Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework and the growing recognition within CITES of the need for systemic approaches to wildlife trade regulation.

records.Title: Progress in and tools for implementing CITES for seahorses.
records.Organizer/Chair: IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature) - Seahorse, Pipefish & Seadragon Specialist Group
records.Description of the side event: Support Parties’ consideration of all seahorse related Decisions being proposed at CoP20, which focus on actions plans, capacity building, monitoring and illegal trade. These draft decisions build upon earlier CITES initiatives aimed at addressing illegal and unsustainable trade in dried seahorses - highlighting a strong shift toward better monitoring, enforcement action, and national-level planning to sustain populations.

records.Title: Strengthening Capacity for Widlife Confiscations: Tools, Training, and Field Experience
records.Organizer/Chair: International Fund for Animal Welfare (IFAW) and co-hosting countries TBC (Congo, Uganda, Brazil)
records.Description of the side event: Showcase successful implementation of training and equient use in the Republic of Congo, Uganda, and Brazil. These cases will illustrate the application of tools and resources in diverse enforcement contexts and share lessons learned from implementation.

records.Title: Siem Reap Declaration
records.Organizer/Chair: IUCN. The event is being co-hosted by elephant range states, IUCN secretariat, SSC Asian Elephant Specialist Group, IUCN Commission and international NGOs
records.Description of the side event: Bring together range States, CITES authorities, intergovernmental agencies, and key conservation stakeholders to present concrete implementation steps taken since the Declaration’s adoption. It will examine how regional cooperation—through transboundary corridors, data sharing, harmonized enforcement and a range range-wide action plan—can be aligned with CITES mandates and mechanisms.

records.Title: Wild Animals Not Pets - Ensuring Responsible Pet Ownership Through Positive Lists in Consumer Markets
records.Organizer/Chair: Animal Advocacy and Protection (AAP); co-host Eurogroup for Animals (EfA)
records.Description of the side event: Provide concrete policy options for Parties aiming to strengthen species conservation, prevent animal suffering, and protect public health. It also highlights the importance of collaboration between CITES authorities, environmental ministries, veterinary and public health sectors.

records.Title: WOAH CC
records.Description of the side event: A key highlight will be the recent designation of National Parks Board Singapore's Centre for Wildlife Forensics as a WOAH Collaborating Centre (CC). We'll discuss the Centre's expertise in wildlife forensics, its role in combating wildlife trafficking, and how this new status enhances international collaboration in wildlife health and trade.

records.Title: CITES & Une Seule Santé (CITES & One Health)
records.Description of the side event: Le commerce international d'espèces sauvages, en particulier d'animaux vivants, est reconnu comme un facteur important contribuant au risque d'émergence, de propagation et de transmission de pathogènes zoonotiques. La mise en œuvre de réglementations internationales sur le commerce des espèces sauvages a un rôle important à jouer dans la prévention, la préparation et la réponse aux futures épidémies et pandémies d'origine zoonotique, à court et à long terme. Cet événement réunira des experts dans les domaines du commerce international des espèces sauvages, de la santé animale et des politiques associées, qui : identifieront les risques de propagation zoonotique associés au commerce international des espèces inscrites à la CITES ; examiner le rôle que les autorités CITES peuvent jouer dans l'atténuation de ces risques grâce à l'adoption et à la mise en œuvre d'une approche « One Health » ; et discuter des mécanismes qui peuvent être adoptés par la Convention pour faciliter ce rôle ; et réfléchir à la manière dont les autorités CITES peuvent contribuer à la mise en œuvre effective de l'accord sur les pandémies adopté par l'Assemblée mondiale de la santé en mai 2025.

records.Title: Scales of Success
records.Description of the side event: Celebratory side event highlighting one of CITES’ greatest conservation triumphs—the recovery of the American alligator.

records.Title: Evidence gaps in wildlife supply chains: a case study of the saiga antelope
records.Description of the side event: aspects of conservation initiatives

records.Title: Nigeria’s New Wildlife Law
records.Organizer/Chair: Co-hosted: Government of Nigeria and Environmental Investigation Agency UK
records.Description of the side event: The event will explore both the content of the Bill and lessons from its develoent, offering insights for other nations seeking to build effective wildlife laws. It will also consider opportunities for collaboration and the challenges ahead in putting the Bill into practice.

records.Title: Trade, African Vultures
records.Organizer/Chair: Niger, co-sponsored by the Convention on Migratory Species (via the Raptors MoU), BirdLife International, the IUCN SSC Vulture Specialist Group (VSG), and the Species Survival Network (SSN).
records.Description of the side event: A group of 13 West and Central African countries has jointly submitted a proposal to transfer the White-backed Vulture (Gyps africanus) and the Rüppell’s Vulture (Gyps rueppelli) from CITES Appendix II to Appendix I, with the aim of strengthening their international protection and more effectively addressing illegal trade. Support informed decision-making regarding the uplisting proposal.

records.Title: Building Innovative responses to wildlife cybercrime
records.Description of the side event: Will examine best-practice by Parties to modernise and adapt legislation and policy frameworks to address the dynamic nature of online markets. This includes updating national laws to explicitly criminalise digital illicit wildlife trade and wildlife trafficking and defining the responsibilities of online platforms.

records.Title: Cheetah's in India
records.Description of the side event: The Side event will have Cheetah expert, Government officials, etc, presenting on the different aspects of conservation initiatives

records.Title: Commiphora wightii
records.Description of the side event: Provides a summary of the key findings of the research and consultations that resulted in the amendment proposal for Commiphora wightii for CITES App. II. Compliance with the listing criteria for CITES Art. II and Resolution Conf. 9.24 (Rev. CoP17) will be demonstrated and possible implications of a listing in App. II presented.

records.Title: Asian big cats & CITES
records.Organizer/Chair: Born Free Foundation, co-hosted with Go Insight, WWF, TRAFFIC, EIA, Panthera, WCS and possibly others
records.Description of the side event: This side event will present key findings and recommendations from a new report examining trends in ABC legal and illegal trade and their population status. It will also assess the implementation of existing CITES measures, highlighting gaps and opportunities for strengthened action.

records.Title: Returning Big Cats to Central Asia
records.Description of the side event: Tigers, cheetah and snow leopards in Central Asia - reintroduction and conservation projects.

records.Title: Shaping CITES’ Future
records.Description of the side event: Explore how CITES can proactively address challenges and opportunities in this ‘brave new world’.

records.Title: Stockpile & HEC tools
records.Organizer/Chair: Co-hosted by the Governments of Angola, Ethiopia, Malawi and Nigeria with the EPI Foundation
records.Description of the side event: A demonstration of EPI tools to strengthen stockpile management and thereby assist Parties to meet their CITES commitments under resolutions 10:10 and 17:10, with practical examples from EPI member countries; and tools deployed by EPI Foundation to tackle human-elephant conflict.

records.Title: CITES Secretariat - Closed meeting
records.Description of the side event: CITES Secretariat - Closed meeting

records.Title: HEC Toolbox Exhibition
records.Description of the side event: This exhibition booth showcases Save the Elephants' Human-Elephant Coexistence Toolbox, a comprehensive manual presenting over 80 scientifically-tested methods for communities to live safely and sustainably alongside elephants.

records.Title: Deepwater Sharks, Rays and Chimaeras: the need for Trade, Conservation and Management Attention
records.Description of the side event: This side event will present information on the planned actions and work plan of the Coalition, noting its relevance to CITES and its Parties and Intergovernmental and non-government organisations.

records.Title: Nature's Project: Forest Eco-classification for Biodiversity
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change “Green Engineering” Design Institute under
records.Description of the side event: Nature's Project: Forest Eco-classification for Biodiversity

records.Title: Confiscation Networks
records.Description of the side event: Will explore policy frameworks and practical mechanisms for creating and strengthening networks that connect wildlife enforcement with qualified animal care facilities, rehabilitation programs, and conservation initiatives.

records.Title: Official Signing ceremony of “Integrated Natural Resources Management for Improved Ecosystem Conservation and Biodiversity Preservation” project
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change FAO-Uzbekistan
records.Description of the side event: Official Signing ceremony of “Integrated Natural Resources Management for Improved Ecosystem Conservation and Biodiversity Preservation” project

records.Title: Is ‘Ranching’ relevant to aquatic species? Case studies, implications and challenges
records.Organizer/Chair: ADM Capital Foundation (co-hosted with WWF, TRAFFIC,  International Council of Environmental Law, IUCN SSC Groupers and Wrasses Specialist Group, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service)
records.Description of the side event: Examines ranching’s evolution, its relevance for aquatic species, and associated sustainability, legal, and enforcement challenges for CITES-listed taxa like Anguilla spp. and Cheilinus undulatus.

records.Title: Science, cooperation and community: the path of hope for the vaquita marina
records.Description of the side event: Science, cooperation and community: the path of hope for the vaquita marina

records.Title: Data for Enforcement
records.Description of the side event: Why is data so important for combating wildlife crime? This event will address this critical question, offering insights into the data available to Parties, preliminary research findings on wildlife crime linked to the Internet, and data-relevant tools available through ICCWC

records.Title: CITES and Forests
records.Description of the side event: Presentation of the matrices that informed the outcomes, the potential scope of an initiative on CITES and forests that will enhance the implementation of the Convention as it relates to forests (with a focus on tree species), and recommendations to enhance the effective implementation of the Convention with respects to CITES-listed forest species.

records.Title: ETIS 2.0 - What's new?
records.Description of the side event: Outline key functionalities and processes now available to Parties through ETIS Online

records.Title: A Life Among Elephants
records.Description of the side event: This event demonstrates the critical role of long-term scientific research in developing effective, sustainable solutions for human-wildlife conflict.

records.Title: How to Conserve Rhinos
records.Organizer/Chair:
International Rhino Foundation. Save the Rhino 
International (co-host)
records.Description of the side event: At this event, International Rhino Foundation and Save the Rhino International will facilitate a panel discussion with rhino conservation, wildlife trade and law enforcement experts, and representatives from rhino range States and CITES Parties affected by the illegal trade in rhino horn specimens. The session will assess what is working, what lessons have been learned and where change is required in order to achieve transformational progress in global rhino conservation efforts. Active engagement with the expert panelists, as well as audience participation, will identify specific recommendations for law enforcement officials and the global conservation community on how to best advance conservation efforts for both African and Asian rhino species.

records.Title: CAR-WEN Initiative
records.Organizer/Chair: Sustainable Innovation Initiatives (SII), co-hosted with the Caribbean Wildlife Enforcement Network (CAR-WEN) Working Group with 20+ participating Caribbean governments
records.Description of the side event: The Caribbean Wildlife Enforcement Network (CAR-WEN) initiative addresses the escalating wildlife crime crisis across the wider Caribbean Region, including illegal trade in parrots, reptiles, marine organisms, and wildlife-derived products. Wildlife crime severely threatens biodiversity conservation, public health, human well-being, animal welfare, and the rule of law. Led by a Working Group of more than 20 Caribbean governments, CAR-WEN’s mission is to formally establish a fully integrated regional wildlife enforcement network aligned with CITES enforcement commitments. This CITES CoP20 side event introduces the CAR-WEN’s vision, strategic priorities, and immediate opportunities for regional and global collaboration.

records.Title: CITES Enforcement
records.Description of the side event:
"Countering the international illegal trade in endangered species requires a multifaceted approach and effective cooperation between countries. China and the European Union (EU) are among the key trading partners, as well as origin and destination for many CITES-listed species. 
The side-event will update participants on efforts in the EU and China, highlighting challenges and opportunities towards combatting wildlife crime, including through cooperation, exchange and joint actions. Effective interventions to address illegal and unsustainable wildlife trade include enabling strong policy frameworks, law enforcement, capacity-building and technical assistance along the trade chains, through to consumer demand change.

records.Title: United for Hammerheads!
records.Organizer/Chair: SHARKPROJECT International. Cohosted with Marine Watch International.
records.Description of the side event: Emphasizes collaboration across producer, transit, and consumer states: aligning science, closing loopholes, and strengthening shared knowledge.

records.Title: CPW in Action & Beyond
records.Organizer/Chair: Collaborative Partnership on Sustainable Wildlife Management (CPW) - Co-hosted by CPW Partner Organizations including FAO, CBD, CIFOR, CITES, CMS, CIC, IIED, IIFB, IUCN, IUFRO, TRAFFIC, UNEP, WOAH
records.Description of the side event: Showcase highlights from the CPW Work Plan 2023–2025, featuring collaborative efforts in areas such as legal coherence, human-wildlife conflict, One Health, and wildlife-based economies. It will also mark the official launch of the CPW Work Plan 2026–2028, a renewed framework designed to align with global biodiversity and develoent priorities while advancing practical, joint action across sectors.

records.Title: An Illusion of Legality: Wildlife Laundering in International Trade
records.Organizer/Chair: Royal United Services Institute, co-hosted with TRAFFIC
records.Description of the side event: Share key findings and discuss their implications with the CITES community, with particular relevance to proposals being considered at CoP20. It will also offer insights into how international and domestic regulatory systems can better close gaps that currently enable laundering under the cover of legality.

records.Title: Illicit Yet Legal Trade
records.Organizer/Chair: Pro Wildlife (co-hosted by IFAW, WCS, Four Paws & Humane World for Animals)
records.Description of the side event: The side event will focus on international trade in species that have been illegally collected in their country of origin but legally traded internationally.

records.Title: Enforcement in action
records.Organizer/Chair: Wildlife Justice Commission. Event co-hosted by Nigeria.
records.Description of the side event: Aimed at informing enforcement-focused discussions on transnational organized wildlife crime and supporting evidence-based policymaking by CITES Parties, the event will offer the latest data, trends, and actionable insights to ensure effective implementation of CITES provisions.

records.Title: AEAP Delivery: MIKE/AEF
records.Description of the side event: Showcase the impact of the MIKE Programme and the African Elephant Fund through real-world experiences from the field. Panelists, including representatives from MIKE sites, elephant range States, donor institutions, and partner organizations, will share success stories and lessons learned.

records.Title: Seventy-ninth meeting of the Standing Committee (SC79)
Tech for Wildlife
records.Description of the side event: Guided by ICCWC’s Guidelines for Wildlife Enforcement Networks (2020) and successful regional enforcement initiatives like ASEAN-WEN and the Lusaka Agreement Task Force, the CAR-WEN Working Group has developed a range of materials and activities to establish a fully functioning wildlife enforcement network (WEN) in the Wider Caribbean. This includes development of a four-phase Strategic Plan, a draft Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), and pilot projects to build enforcement capacity, demonstrate immediate benefits, and foster regional commitment. With the MOU expected to open for signature by early next year, this event represents a timely opportunity for stakeholder input and engagement.

records.Title: The Challenge of Defining "Ruin" versus "Risk" in Marine Species: Party proponents, FAO Expert Panel & Fishers talk to CoP20 Assessments on Shark, Eel, Sea Cucumbers & Shellfish
records.Description of the side event:
Description: Determining the balance between investments in fisheries management and biodiversity protection is in part shaped by consideration of CITES Resolution Conf. 9.24, and the ongoing debate between precautionary and evidence-based approaches.
In this Side Event discussion—drawing on inputs from Parties, the FAO Expert Panel convenor, proposal proponents, and fisheries organizations— we open the hood on approaches to assessing extinction risk for CoP20 Proposals 28–37 and 39.
A central theme of this dialogue will be the characterization of ‘extinction risk’, with perspectives from fisheries, trade, and species conservation explored to highlight differing levels of risk tolerance and aversion.

records.Title: Uplisting to release - CITES and National Action Driving Success for the Barbary Macaque
records.Organizer/Chair: Animal Advocacy and Protection (AAP); co-hosts: Morocco; Utrecht University
records.Description of the side event: Explore the impact of the macaque’s uplisting to CITES Appendix I and how it sparked a systemic national response in Morocco. Since 2017, stronger enforcement, public awareness campaigns, and government-led protection of wild populations have helped reduce illegal trade.

records.Title: CITES AIA-ID Initiative
records.Organizer/Chair: China (China CITES SA: Endangered Species Scientific Commission, PRC (ESSC)
records.Description of the side event: Share the significant progress achieved, including the gap analysis; Demonstrate real-time queries using the CITES AIA-ID Navigator; Invite collaboration through an expert panel and additional image datasets;

records.Title: Biodiversity degradation in Uzbekistan under climate change and the unsustainable use of ecosystem resources to secure environmental and national security of the region
records.Organizer/Chair: Research Institute of Environmental and Nature Conservation Technologies under the Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change
records.Description of the side event: Biodiversity degradation in Uzbekistan under climate change and the unsustainable use of ecosystem resources to secure environmental and national security of the region

records.Title: Forensics: a CITES tool
records.Description of the side event: Address the potential for wildlife forensic techniques to support the legal trade of wildlife by ensuring that wildlife products are certified legally sourced, captive bred or free from wild sourced laundering.

records.Title: Fish Maw Trade Impacts
records.Organizer/Chair: Animal Welfare Institute. Co-hosts: BLOOM HK, Center for Biological Diversity, Environmental Investigation Agency, IUCN Croaker and Drum Specialist Group, Natural Resources Defense Council, Wildlife Conservation Society.
records.Description of the side event: A panel of experts will explore the global scope of the fish maw trade, how it is affecting CITES-listed and other species, the urgent need for regulation of fisheries and trade, and the potential for collaboration between CITES and other intergovernmental organizations. They will discuss how CITES can provide a leadership role to improve the sustainability and traceability of the fish maw trade.

records.Title: Catalyzing ecosystem restoriation in Uzbekistan: launch of the GEF-8 ERIP Project
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change of the Republic of Uzbekistan, GEF, IUCN, UNDP.
records.Description of the side event: Catalyzing ecosystem restoriation in Uzbekistan: launch of the GEF-8 ERIP Project

records.Title: A CMS Global Initiative
records.Organizer/Chair: Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species (with UZBEKISTAN, TURKMENISTAN, CPW and WCS)
records.Description of the side event: Present the Global Initiative on Illegal and Unsustainable Taking of Species at the National Level, a collaborative response under the Convention on Migratory Species (CMS) to a major but often overlooked threat—domestic taking of wildlife for local use, trade, cultural or other purposes.

records.Title: What works to stop IWT?
records.Description of the side event: Understanding what effectively reduces wildlife trafficking is essential for a wide range of stakeholders, including policymakers, regulatory and enforcement authorities, and funding institutions. Evidence-based knowledge can guide the prioritization, targeting, evaluation, and refinement of interventions aimed at combating wildlife trafficking.

records.Title: Eightieth meeting of the Standing Committee (SC80)
Conservation of Lions
records.Description of the side event: Will have experts, Government officials, etc, presenting on the different

records.Title: BBNJ Agreement & CITES
records.Organizer/Chair: Co-hosted by the CITES Secretariat and the Division for Ocean Affairs and the Law of the Sea (DOALOS) of the Office of Legal Affairs of the United Nations and the CITES Secretariat
records.Description of the side event: This side event aims to promote a better understanding of the BBNJ Agreement and opportunities it provides to support the achievement of the objectives of CITES, and to explore synergies between the two instruments, as well as opportunities and challenges to leverage such synergies.

records.Title: A Decade of Demand Reduction
records.Organizer/Chair:
TRAFFIC - co-hosted with the German
 government through BMUKN
records.Description of the side event: Review highlights, success stories, challenges and lessons learned from efforts to reduce demand for CITES-listed species, whilst also engaging expert opinion over what this might mean for market mitigation measures moving forward

records.Title: GWP: CITES synergies
records.Organizer/Chair: World Bank as lead agency of Global Wildlife Program. GWP is funded by the GEF with partners, UNDP, UNEP, ADB, IUCN, WWF, CI, TRAFFIC, CITES Secretariat, CMS Secretariat, WCS, TRAFFIC and WildAid.
records.Description of the side event: This event will explore these synergies between GWP and CITES implementation. It will showcase examples from Parties on how their GWP national projects are addressing the drivers of illegal and unsustainable trade and supporting CITES implementation, and profile GWP work on behavior change and collaboration with ICCWC on counter wildlife trafficking.

records.Title: Tiger trade & the law
records.Organizer/Chair: TRAFFIC along with WWF and Legal Atlas
records.Description of the side event: This side event will present key findings and recommendations from the latest Skin and Bones report, drawing on 25 years of seizure data across tiger range countries.

records.Title: Samarkand Declaration
records.Organizer/Chair: Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change of the Republic of Uzbekistan, co-hosted with TRAFFIC
records.Description of the side event: This session will introduce the state of wildlife trade in the region, based on the TRAFFIC report, and priorities for action. It will highlight the political will and shared vision among the five Central Asian nations to safeguard biodiversity, enable legal and sustainable trade, and dismantle transboundary trafficking networks. It will also offer a platform for dialogue with CITES Parties and partners on opportunities for collaborative implementation, technical assistance, and investment in community-based conservation.

records.Title: Trade in endemic species
records.Description of the side event: Address the problem of trade in endemic species without proof of legal export from the country of origin – where the species naturally occurs and where they are often specially protected. The consequences of this trade for wild populations will be analyzed, as well as possible CITES mechanisms that can solve this problem.

records.Title: Saiga: new challenges
records.Organizer/Chair: The Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the Ministry of ecology, environmental protection and climate change of the Republic of Uzbekistan
records.Description of the side event: Present scientific data on population dynamics, the socio-economic impacts of overabundance, and Kazakhstan’s rationale for lifting the zero export quota under CITES. Special attention will be given to transboundary cooperation with Uzbekistan and other range states, as well as ensuring that any potential future use remains legal, traceable, and biologically sustainable.

records.Title: Tarántulas en Ap. II
records.Organizer/Chair: Argentina, Bolivia, Panamá, AWI y SSN
records.Description of the side event: Analyse the current state of trade in tarantulas and other terrestrial invertebrates, its implications for biodiversity, and opportunities to improve its management and regulation. Discussions will focus on challenges in traceability and the role of instruments such as CITES in ensuring that international trade does not threaten the survival of these species.

records.Title: CITES' effectiveness
records.Organizer/Chair: IUCN Sustainable Use and Livelihoods Specialist Group
records.Description of the side event: It will focus on recognizing CITES successes and then evaluating how the Convention could be more successful. There will be a small number of presentations followed by a panel discussion and a broader discussion with attendees. The event relates to agenda items 13, 27, 29, 76, 84 and 114 (Proposals to amend Appendices I and II).

records.Title: Ensuring Legality and Sustainability of the Live Wild Animal Trade in Central Asia
records.Description of the side event: Seeks to raise awareness, foster dialogue, and build partnerships that support sustainable and legal trade while safeguarding biodiversity. It will be of interest to CITES Parties, enforcement agencies, NGOs, and researchers focused on wildlife trade and conservation in emerging and understudied regions.

records.Title: EU Timber Imports
records.Description of the side event: The EU will present its draft guidance, which is intended to be used by the Scientific Authorities of EU Member States when conducting NDFs for timber species listed under CITES. There will be opportunities for questions and feedback on the draft guidance.

records.Title: Pangolin Trade in China
records.Description of the side event: Present the findings of research on Chinese court cases relating to the illegal trade of pangolins. The themes of discussion will be legal domestic markets for pangolins in China, the sourcing of pangolins in illegal trade, routes and methods that are used for illegal smuggling, and strengths and weaknesses in regulation, enforcement and prosecution.

records.Title: Global Songbird Crisis
records.Organizer/Chair: Sustainable Innovation Initiatives (SII) and co-hosts, including the IUCN SSC ASTSG, EAZA, BirdLife International, Monitor, Creative Conservation Lab, and the newly forming Neotropical Songbirds Collaborative Group.
records.Description of the side event: Highlight case studies from Asia, Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and the Neotropics, enriched by regional songbird sights and sounds. Experts will share insights into the cultural drivers of trade, effective regulatory approaches, policy interventions, and practical conservation solutions.

records.Title: Wildlife Economy
records.Organizer/Chair:
The international Council for Game and Wildlife 
Conservation (CIC) and Sustainable Use Organizations Network
records.Description of the side event: As the scope of CITES continues to expand, there is a growing concern that its core mission—ensuring that international trade in wild species is legal, sustainable, and traceable—risks being diluted. This side event will provide a space to critically examine the current agenda and assess how to realign priorities with the Convention's foundational goals.

records.Title: United for Big Cats
records.Organizer/Chair: Go Insight, co-hosted with the International Big Cat Alliance and the South Asian Wildlife Enforcement Network

records.Title: SSN/Bavin Awards Event
records.Description of the side event: Emphasizes collaboration across producer, transit, and consumer states: aligning science, closing loopholes, and strengthening shared knowledge.

records.Title: Illegal Sloth Trade LA
records.Organizer/Chair: Costa Rica- Brazil – Panama - Peru with support of Species Survival Network, Humane World for Animals, and IFAW (Event is co-hosted)
records.Description of the side event: Bring together technical experts, law enforcement authorities, and international specialists to shed light on this growing crisis, present key evidence, and support the proposal to list both species in Appendix II of CITES. This measure aims to strengthen trade regulation and assist range states in their conservation efforts.

records.Title: Stronger Together
records.Description of the side event: Spotlight key achievements and collaborative efforts under the CITES-CMS JPW, 2021–2025, reinforcing the importance of synergies between the two Conventions in addressing the conservation status of species listed under both Conventions.

records.Title: A Documentary on Chinese Pangolin Conservation
records.Description of the side event: Screening of the film DEFENDERS OF THE HIDDEN

records.Title: Primates Trafficking
records.Organizer/Chair: Legal Atlas (co-hosting with Gov of Uganda, PASA and IFAW)
records.Description of the side event: Launches the proposal submitted to CITES by the Government of Uganda for the creation of a CITES Great Apes Enforcement Task Force. Supporting the initiative, legal and conservation organizations will provide the latest insights on the trade in live great apes, as well as new tools available in support of legal develoent and law enforcement.

records.Title: Seventy-ninth meeting of the Standing Committee (SC79)
Hunting trophies policy
records.Organizer/Chair: IUCN Sustainable Use and Livelihoods Specialist Group
records.Description of the side event: Present analyses of trophy hunting, the threat to species from trophy hunting, and implications for policymaking, and draws on trophy hunting of African rhinoceroses as a case study.

records.Title: CITES Secretariat - ICCWC - Closed Meeting
records.Description of the side event: CITES Secretariat - ICCWC - Closed Meeting

records.Title: African Forest and Savanna Elephants: Update of the Status Report
records.Organizer/Chair: IUCN SSC African Elephant Specialist Group
records.Description of the side event: Present two landmark publications: the African Forest Elephant Status Report (AFESR) and the African Savanna Elephant Status Report (ASESR). These are the first separate reports since the recognition in 2021 of Loxodonta cyclotis and Loxodonta africana as distinct species, based on robust genetic, ecological, and morphological evidence.

records.Title: Trade in frogs’ legs
records.Description of the side event: Present the scope and ecological impact of the international trade in frog legs.

records.Title: CGYN
records.Description of the side event:
"This session examines how to meaningfully integrate youth into conservation efforts at national and international levels, focusing on their role in legal and sustainable wildlife trade.

We'll explore the evolution of the CITES Global Youth Network (CGYN), showcasing how young people worldwide helped shape its vision, mission and projects through two key Singapore-based events: the CITES Youth Leadership Programme and the CITES Global Youth Summit.

Youth representatives will share their experiences in mobilising grassroots action and contributing to sustainable wildlife trade through the Network.

Join us to discuss how wildlife trade governance could transform when young people are empowered to lead rather than merely participate."

records.Title: Civil Society sharing wildlife crime information with law enforcement
records.Organizer/Chair: United for Wildlife and the Nature Crime Alliance (with support from INTERPOL Wildlife Crime Working Group)
records.Description of the side event: Information sharing and collaborative between law enforcement and civil society to combat wildlife crime. It will spotlight practical tools to improve coordination, build trust, and enable impactful enforcement.

records.Title: ICCWC’s Impact: Showcasing Global Successes
records.Description of the side event: A showcase of ICCWC’s successes at national and international levels, including Parties’ experiences, the achievements of WIRE 2025 and Operation THUNDER 2025, and reflections on what works to disrupt a wildlife trafficking network.

records.Title: CITES NDF Guidance
records.Description of the side event: Present the NDF guidance developed in terms of Decision 19. 132 - 19.134 including case studies presented by Parties on the use of the guidance.

records.Title: Silk Road's small cats
records.Organizer/Chair: CO-HOSTS: The Pallas's cat International Conservation Alliance (PICA) / The Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection & Climate Change, Uzbekistan / Institute of Zoology, Academy of Sciences, Uzbekistan / Conservation X labs
records.Description of the side event: Discuss the role of transnational collaborations between range country governments, scientific institutions and conservation authorities in raising the profile of Pallas’s cats on global conservation agenda, a model which could be replicated for other small cats.

records.Title: Sharks Protection Cop20
records.Description of the side event: Highlight regional leadership in advancing key shark and ray proposals for CITES CoP20. As the proponent of the Oceanic Whitetip Shark listing and a cosponsor of other shark and ray species, Panama will showcase the science and policy rationale behind these efforts.

records.Title: Striped Hyena at Risk
records.Organizer/Chair: Republic of Tajikistan and Republic of Uzbekistan and The Nature And Biodiversity Conservation Union
records.Description of the side event:
"This side event, co-hosted by the Republic of Tajikistan and the Republic of Uzbekistan, will spotlight the urgent need for coordinated international action to conserve the striped hyena (Hyaena hyaena), a keystone scavenger species facing increasing threats across its range. Despite its ecological importance in controlling disease vectors and contributing to ecosystem health, the striped hyena remains underrepresented in global conservation dialogues.

The event will provide a platform to:

Present the latest data on the species’ conservation status across its transboundary range;
Examine the role of international legal instruments, including CITES and the Convention on Migratory Species (CMS), in strengthening protection measures;
Launch the reassessment process for the IUCN Red List status of the striped hyena, with input from range states, experts, and conservation partners.
By bringing together policymakers, scientists, and civil society, this session aims to catalyze a shift in global policy perception—recognizing the striped hyena not only as a species of conservation concern but also as a vital ally in reducing zoonotic disease risks. The event will also explore opportunities for regional cooperation, funding mechanisms, and integration of the species into national biodiversity strategies.

Join us to help shape a new conservation narrative for one of the most misunderstood and ecologically valuable carnivores in the world."

records.Title: African hornbills
records.Organizer/Chair: Nigeria.   Co-host: IUCN SSC HSG, Mabula Ground Hornbill Project MGHP, AZA. African Hornbill SAFE Programme, EAZA, Monitor Conservation Research Society (Monitor), WCS, World Association of Zoos and Aquaria (WAZA), International Bird Conservation Partnership (IBCP)
records.Description of the side event: Presenting current hornbill trade research as well as new information resources that can be used for the CITES decision-making process.

records.Title: Jaguars at a Crossroads
records.Organizer/Chair: Panthera co-hosted by Brazil, Mexico and the Jaguar 2030 Coordination Committee: Global Wildlife Program, Inter American Development Bank, IUCN Cat Specialist Group, Panthera, UNDP, UNEP, UNODC, WCS, World Bank, and WWF, with the CITES and CMS Secretariats
records.Description of the side event: Range States will share how their actions on jaguars under CITES and CMS can help achieve their commitments under the CBD and Global Biodiversity Framework, among other environmental initiatives, with great significance for Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities throughout Latin America.

records.Title: Rethinking Trade Data - Exploring Solutions to Strengthen Wildlife Trade Data
records.Organizer/Chair: Animal Advocacy and Protection (AAP); co-hosts: Dominican Republic; Eurogroup for Animals (EfA); International Fund for Animal Welfare (IFAW); Fondation Franz Weber (FFW)
records.Description of the side event:
"Exploring solutions to strengthen wildlife trade data

Monitoring global wildlife trade remains challenging due to inconsistent data, limited species information, and fragmented systems. This side event brings together global experts to evaluate strengths and gaps in existing trade monitoring tools like LEMIS (USA) and TRACES (EU), and explore how these systems can be improved.

Examine how effective current tools are to track wildlife in trade, and the impact of data gaps on species conservation and listing proposals. Panelists will share case studies, assess the strengths and weaknesses of existing databases, and propose practical recommendations.

The discussion will also explore how enhanced data collection, harmonized systems, and real-time access to trade records can significantly strengthen the implementation of CITES and national legislation. Improved monitoring capacity can support not only customs and wildlife authorities but also law enforcement and prosecutors in detecting, investigating, and successfully prosecuting wildlife crime.

records.Title: Sustainable Use of CEAS
records.Description of the side event: This Side Event will showcase SEAFDEC’s initiatives and highlight regional collaboration in the management and conservation of Commercially Exploited Aquatic Species (CEAS), particularly those subject to proposed CITES listings such as sharks, rays, and tropical eels.

records.Title: National Environmental Atlas
records.Description of the side event: National Environmental Atlas presentation

records.Title: Presentation of Ramsar National Strategy of Uzbekistan The importance of Ramsar sites for biodiversity and migratory species
records.Organizer/Chair: GIZ-Uzbekistan Ministry of Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change of the Republic of Uzbekistan Michael Succow Foundation (MSF)
records.Description of the side event: Presentation of Ramsar National Strategy of Uzbekistan The importance of Ramsar sites for biodiversity and migratory species

records.Title: Eel-Legal Trade
records.Description of the side event: Examine the challenges this brings to conservation, trade and enforcement around the world.

records.Title: CMS, CITES and Sharks
records.Organizer/Chair: Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species (with GERMANY and Sharks MOU Advisory Committee)
records.Description of the side event: Highlight how CITES and CMS can jointly strengthen shark and ray conservation, which are essential for healthy marine ecosystems and sustainable fisheries. It will promote dialogue among Parties, stakeholders, and experts to identify practical steps to strengthen cooperation at both the Secretariat and national levels.

records.Title: Sustainable MAPs trade: Healing Plants, Healthy Trade through Strengthening CITES Implementation for Medicinal and Aromatic Plants
records.Organizer/Chair: TRAFFIC International. Event co-hosted with IUCN Medicinal Plant Specialist Group, UK CITES SA for Flora, Nepal CITES SA
records.Description of the side event: Provide a platform for Parties and stakeholders to explore progress and next steps in implementing CoP19 Decisions 19.261–264, which call for enhanced capacity building, information exchange, and regional cooperation in the regulation of MAP trade.

records.Title: CITES Music Instruments
records.Organizer/Chair: League of American Orchestras, co-hosted by the International Alliance of Violin and Bow Makers
records.Description of the side event: Provide background on the historic and ongoing use of musical instruments and the instrument-making process as it relates to CoP20 agenda items.

records.Title: Driving Collaborative Solutions: CITES’ Role in One Health and Convergence Challenges
records.Organizer/Chair:
FOUR PAWS International
Co-host: The Donkey Sanctuary
records.Description of the side event: Examine the systemic misuse of CITES Purpose Code “Z”, which is increasingly used to facilitate commercial trade in Appendix I species under the pretext of non-commercial purposes such as conservation or zoological exchange.

records.Title: IUCN Red List and CITES
records.Description of the side event: Highlight how the Red List informs and enhances CITES processes and detail important updates to the Red List since CoP19, including the reassessment of all amphibian species in 2023 and the global freshwater assessment in 2024.

records.Title: Legal Acquisition Findings
records.Description of the side event: Examine the challenges and best practices for the making of legal acquisition findings, and their central role in conservation, trade and enforcement around the world.

records.Title: CITES and Local Voices
records.Organizer/Chair: BirdLife International, in collaboration with the governments of Indonesia and the Philippines, and Mandai Nature
records.Description of the side event: The session aims to inspire more inclusive, community-driven approaches that amplify community voices and strengthen local confidence and capacity to deliver long-term, positive outcomes for the conservation of internationally traded species and effective implementation of CITES commitments on the ground.

records.Title: eCITES Permit System
records.Description of the side event: This side event will provide a platform for Parties, experts, and stakeholders to explore strategic approaches to fully implement eCITES systems in line with relevant CITES Resolutions and Decisions.

records.Title: Sea Cucumber Trade
records.Description of the side event: Examine these implementation experiences, highlighting available tools, enduring challenges, and lessons learned, and will explore how they can inform forthcoming proposals.

records.Title: CITES e-learning tools
records.Description of the side event:
"This side event will highlight an array of digital tools and online learning opportunities available to Parties and the general public. As the world continues to shift online, it is vital that multilateral environmental agreements like CITES tap into new resources to encourage learning and development. 

On the occasion of the 20th Meeting of the Conference of the Parties, the CITES Secretariat will be launching the brand new CITES E-learning course, where users can learn about the Convention and different themes that are key for implementing CITES, including:
CITES Authorities
Regulation & exemptions
Reporting requirements
Non-detriment findings and export quotas
Legal Acquisition Findings
Review of Significant Trade
Compliance procedures
Transport of Live Specimens

The interactive course is free and open to the public, and users receive a certificate upon completion. 

The event will also walk through different online platforms, such as the UNEP InforMEA Initiative, to showcase resources for Parties, such as a collection of national reports, the Negotiator’s Toolkit, and the new Global Goals page. This will demonstrate different tools that can be used during the CoP, throughout the reporting process, and when developing plans to harmonize CITES implementation and the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

The side event aims to help participants learn more about the resources available to them and how they can use digital tools to enhance their work on CITES."

records.Title: Whale sharks & friends
records.Description of the side event: Provide a snapshot of the key role these species play in the Maldives by supporting sustainable tourism livelihoods, along with the science supporting the listings, the anticipated benefits of this uplisting, and the enforcement mechanisms needed for success.

records.Title: Leopard: Forgotten Cats
records.Organizer/Chair:
Environmental Investigation Agency co-hosted
 with Panthera
records.Description of the side event: This side event will shine a spotlight on leopards, and why this widespread but heavily persecuted species is at risk of “disappearing in silence.” It will cover assessments showing a severe reduction in their population and range in South-East Asia; legal domestic markets for leopard products in Asia; the scale and nature of illegal trade in leopards as seen through seizures, prosecutions and trade observations.
